executive_summary: Wall Street law firm serving as intelligence front through revolving door between corporate clients and government positions. Partners Allen and John Foster Dulles orchestrated coups benefiting firm clients.
key_findings: Founded 1879, became premier Wall Street law firm
John Foster Dulles: partner → Secretary of State 1953-1959
Represented United Fruit (Guatemala coup beneficiary), Anglo-Iranian Oil (Iran coup beneficiary)
Attorney-client privilege provided operational security for coup planning
concealment_strategy: Corporate-state fusion model: Attorney-client privilege conceals coup planning, revolving door ensures continuity, corporate interests drive policy
